Posted By: DoragonShinzui (3/7/2012 8:39:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: OH YESSSSS !!!!! The cure for the artifact decks has arrived!!!!! [Arcbound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcbound) creatures now have a chance of seeing serious play more so than ever before.... Maybe even the real crappy ones. [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter) and other [Thopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thopter) kin are now blessed to have such a fast booster instead of the crummy Holy or Unholy strength type boosters. Free counters will flow like wine. Not to mention [Fate Transfer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fate Transfer) will be used to fight off creature removal from not Modular creatures to continue the fight without too much delay. FINALLY, WotC has given me a card I REALLY enjoy....It amped all my artifact decks 10 fold!!!!!! THANKS WIZARDS!!!!!!! The shame is trying to get copies of these things after release. Hang onto them when you get'em and wait until Scars of Mirrodin shows. Artifacts will rule those days!!!!!

Posted By: raadface (2/23/2011 2:59:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy will be insane in three months. On its own, it's a great, efficient "lord" of artifact creatures which is not terrible without any underlings. With a whole crew of artifact creatures popping up in the fall, *this* is going to be a card to watch. I'm not going to be arrogant enough to try to "guarantee" anything, but I will be very surprised if there aren't numerous high-performing competitive decks playing four of these when Scars of Mirrodin comes out.
posts.html:

I *really* hope we get some hardcore artifact hate in scars. A reprint of [Ancient Grudge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Grudge) would be in order, but even that would not be enough.
